com.lxisoft.battle.game.app

Class GuessGameLauncher

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lxisoft.battle.game.app.GuessGameLauncher

  • public class GuessGameLauncher
extends java.lang.Object
    Main class of the Guessing Game [Battleship Edition]
    The main game loop is executed by this class. The GameLauncher class acts as the entry point for the game during execution.
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Devanand

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException

        java.io.IOException

      • runGame

        public static void runGame()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Contains the main game execution loop

        Calls the initializeGame() method to setup the initial parameters for game execution. Then runs the game and reads player input and updates the board state, player scores and other game state variables. Execution will loop until the game exit conditions as defined by the isGameNotOver() method are set. Upon completion of the game, it also calls the GameEngine.showScores() to display the scores before exiting.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • isGameNotOver

        private static boolean isGameNotOver()
        Evaluates the game exit conditions

        Uses the GameEngine.isAllCellSelected() method and GameEngine.isAllGuessesOver() method to check if the game exit conditions have been satisfied.
        Returns:
        boolean true if game is not over, else false

      • initializeGame

        private static void initializeGame()
        Setup initial game parameters

        This method displays the initial instructions to the players, reads and verifies the size specified for the game board and the number of players. It also allows the players to set custom names for themselves (using the GameEngine.setCustomPlayerNames() method). It also creates a new GameEngine object, initializes it and generates a new board (using the GameEngine.fillBoard(int) method).

        The method also specifies the sizes allowed for the board and also checks the minimum and maximum number of players allowed for each board size. The method will throw exception if any of the conditions is not satisfied by the user input.

        See Also:
        GameEngine.setCustomPlayerNames(), GameEngine.fillBoard(int)
